subSections.title: Related characters
subSections.text:
* {{l|mul|[[齧]]}} ''(Orthodox {{w|Traditional Chinese characters|traditional form}} of <big>嚙</big>)'' and {{l|mul|[[囓]]}} ''({{w|Variant Chinese characters|Variant}} {{w|Traditional Chinese characters|traditional form}} of {{l|mul|齧}})''
* {{l|mul|[[噛]]}} ''(Japanese {{w|shinjitai}})''
* {{l|mul|[[啮]]}} ''({{w|Simplified Chinese}})''

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Note that in {{w|traditional Chinese}}, <big>嚙</big> is considered as a {{w|Variant Chinese characters|variant form}} of {{l|mul|齧}} ''(same in meaning and usage but different in appearance)'' whereas in Japanese, <big>嚙</big> (''{{w|shinjitai}} form: {{l|mul|噛}})'' and {{l|mul|齧}} (''{{w|shinjitai}} form: {{l|mul|𪘂}})'' are used differently in their compound words.
